meanings.definition: The act of delaying or postponing something.
meanings.sent1: The deferral of the meeting allowed everyone more time to prepare.
meanings.sent2: I requested a deferral of my payment until next month.
meanings.sent3: The deferral of dessert until after dinner made the kids impatient.
meanings.sent4: Her deferral of the decision created a sense of suspense in the room.
meanings.sent5: The deferral of the movie release date built up anticipation among fans.

meanings.definition: The action of putting off an event or action to a later time.
meanings.sent1: The deferral of the party to next weekend disappointed some guests.
meanings.sent2: His deferral of the project deadline caused delays in the schedule.
meanings.sent3: The deferral of the game night made the players eager for the next gathering.
meanings.sent4: The deferral of the concert due to bad weather upset many fans.
meanings.sent5: Her deferral of the decision to resign kept everyone in suspense.

meanings.definition: The act of withholding or holding back something.
meanings.sent1: The deferral of information led to misunderstandings among the team.
meanings.sent2: The deferral of the truth only prolonged the inevitable confrontation.
meanings.sent3: His deferral of the secret made his friends curious about what he was hiding.
meanings.sent4: The deferral of emotions eventually resulted in an outburst.
meanings.sent5: Her deferral of the apology made the situation more tense.
